result.execSummary:
The defendant Luther V Arndt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 108 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow transfer to any other county if deemed appropriate by D.O.C.
Court costs ($243) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision in Count 1 of this Case.  Court waives DNA surcharge on Count 2.

STRAIGHT TIME.
Apply 108 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Counts 1 and 3.
Court costs ($243) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision in Count 1 of this Case.  Court waives DNA surcharge on Count 3.

STRAIGHT TIME.
Apply 108 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Counts 1 and 2.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: December 17, 2014.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Luther V Arndt in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.   
Court quashes warrant.

State presented their sentencing recommendation.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison: 39 Months.
Initial Confinement: 15 Months.
Extended Supervision: 24 Months.
108  Days Credit

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
Court will allow transfer to any other county if deemed appropriate by D.O.C. 
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
DNA Sample if not already provided.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.



Count 2:
 6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail.
108 Days Credit.
Concurrent to counts 1 and 3.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision on count 1.



Count 3:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail.
108 Days Credit.
Concurrent to counts 1 & 2.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision on Count 1.
